I've seen quite a bit of material on using NEAT for robotic control and mor=
e recently using CPPNs for evolving robot morphology, but I don't recall se=
eing anything being done in the area of perception and understanding / worl=
d modeling alone.  Is anyone working in this area?  I realize that for most=
 of the robot control, there is implied perception - that is, mapping some =
aspects of a world through a NN-based policy to actions - but what I'm inte=
rested in is doing things like object recognition or something along the li=
nes of more traditional computer vision.

Also, if anyone is willing to col=
laborate on this or any other NEAT-related efforts in robotics, I'd love to=
 talk to you.  I'm trying to drum up support for doing research in evolutio=
nary robotics at my lab (Lockheed Martin Advanced Technology Labs' Intellig=
ent Robotics Lab).  It's been a subject I've long been interested in, but h=
ave never had much opportunity to actually work on outside of my own side p=
robjects and school.


-- Chris
